div.p: It is my pleasurable duty, dear Mr. Smyth, to convey to you the best thanks of the trustees of the Royal Park for your goodness of preparing such a beautiful plan of their ground, also to solicit your acceptance of the position of chairmanship of a subcommittee (consisting of yourself, C. Hodgkinson Esq and Dr Thomas Black) whose good offices are sought to define the intended carriage drive by pegs, to determine on the permanent levels, necessary drains and culverts, with a view of tenders being prepared as early as possible for the formation of these drives. The trustees direct me also to convey to you their grateful acknowledgement for your having in connection with Dr Black preliminarily fixed the line of the new drive in so satisfactory a manner.

div.p: I have the honor to remain
